headline: Bullish & other crypto names see 'tons' of demand from equity
summary: Bullish (BLSH) skyrocketed in its public debut on Wednesday, drawing attention to a growing wave of crypto firms hitting the market. Ed Engel, Compass Point research and trading senior analyst, discusses Bullish's focus on non-US markets and how the company stacks up against names like Coinbase (COIN) in a competitive global exchange landscape. To watch more expert insights and analysis on the latest market action, check out more Market Domination.

headline: Why Coinbase (COIN) Stock Is Up Today
summary: Shares of blockchain infrastructure company Coinbase (NASDAQ:COIN) jumped 3.1% in the morning session after a broad rally in the cryptocurrency market, fueled by cooling inflation data that reinforced expectations for a Federal Reserve interest rate cut in September. The rally pushed the total cryptocurrency market capitalization above $4.1 trillion.

raw.headline: Why Coinbase (COIN) Stock Is Up Today
raw.summary: Shares of blockchain infrastructure company Coinbase (NASDAQ:COIN) jumped 3.1% in the morning session after a broad rally in the cryptocurrency market, fueled by cooling inflation data that reinforced expectations for a Federal Reserve interest rate cut in September. The rally pushed the total cryptocurrency market capitalization above $4.1 trillion.

headline: Coinbase’s Q2 Earnings Call: Our Top 5 Analyst Questions
summary: Coinbase’s second quarter was met with a negative market reaction as revenue growth fell short of Wall Street’s expectations, despite a significant beat on non-GAAP profit. Management attributed the shortfall primarily to a decline in trading volumes, driven by reduced crypto asset volatility and a strategic shift in stablecoin pair pricing. CFO Alesia Haas noted, “Crypto asset volatility declined 16%, despite the average crypto price market cap being roughly flat,” underscoring the impact of ma

headline: COIN Q2 Deep Dive: Revenue Misses Estimates, Profit Surpasses Expectations Amid Product Expansion
summary: Blockchain infrastructure company Coinbase (NASDAQ:COIN) missed Wall Street’s revenue expectations in Q2 CY2025 as sales rose 3.3% year on year to $1.50 billion. Its non-GAAP profit of $5.14 per share was significantly above analysts’ consensus estimates.
